comments.body: Yeah, currently there’s no way to get the moss off of mossy blocks. Using a brush to do this would give them another use. When brushing the moss off, maybe they could even drop moss carpet.
I think it should be called “grappling hook”
This needs to be a thing
I was about to post this feedback. I really agree with this idea.
Amazing Idea
I love it, you have my vote as a fellow builder

They'll really need a good purpose if they'll ever be added.

So, they could drop flint and gravel when mined, and could be craftable with a block of stone or cobblestone in a crafting grid.
As long as the Netherite block can't be reduced to ingots, otherwise it would make Netherite armor and tools way easier to make.
Yeah that would be great

*Edit*

I think that to make this not game breaking, the crafting recipe could be reduced to 4 ingots in a 2x2 crafting grid. The 9 diamonds would stay the same, and if you combine a diamond block with a netherite, and break up the block, you now have 4 netherite ingots instead of an overwhelming 9.
yes this would be game breaking
That's to much STONKS to be added to Minecraft.
IT'S AN INVESTMENT!!!
Just use a cat.
That's uneasy to carry a cat everywhere, and phantoms still spawn and annoy you with their cries.
And now with the coming Caves & Cliffs Update, we could find this totem as a rare artifact in the archeology excavation sites!
you would have to craft it with a block mixer!
I was thinking about the same thing
But if that's the case, then you can add add new block with out over ridding existing blocks or usind entities or tile entities. Also I am taking about Java bedrock has this already.
Like shift+click fences, walls, etc. so individual pillars are created and not connected?
I feel like you would need a block like, Snowed Ice, where you can then use a stone cutter to get the other varients.
Or maybe call it "Totem of Trust" drop by the piglin brutes!
It should be done so that when the palisade blocks are stacked, the top block has a pointed end. Or have the pointed end be a separate block.  A “finished” palisades  block.

Or Wooden Beams

It could be with bark and stripped beams, this would take vanilla building to a new level.
It could happen in terms of a Forest update, with new trees with thinner stems.
Why not instead have like a 5% chance that if netherite items are smelted then you get netherite nugget that after 9 equal a scrap and then you can work towards a netherite ingot
I think it should be better, if developers add netherite nuggets (9 nuggets = 1 ingot), but still good idea. Vote for you!
If this was implemented, you would be able to farm netherite if you just had a ton of time and a ton of gold. I don’t think the devs want that.
Netherite Hoe was removed from Bartering loot tables (sadly) and this would not make netherite farmable anymore
EPIC IDEA! FRIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIICK YEAH THATS EPIC

I think having saddles only available in chests or raids makes the game more interesting since you either have to explore or fight. Also, after a raid the amount of saddles you get can be very taxing on your storage system.

We need this, the first time I played in 1.16 I thought they weren't transparent and annually considered full blocks but no my contraption didn't work and I got infuriated and still couldn't make my machine work after I redesigned it.
It’s it has been submitted to the bug tracker, but I don’t see any mention of fixing it in the most recent snapshot notes.
Well java got that feature but bedrock didn't yet. I'm not surprised tbh

I really want this. Since the game does not give us any white fences and trap doors, I used to use these to complete the look of an arch. Now I can’t anymore. I had know idea the piston trick no longer worked and designed white arches expecting to use the iron trap doors.
I urgently need this for my fireplace!

Un-lit campfires could be an item, (making it far easier to use unlit campfires in creative builds, [ie. in rafts, bridges, or just as unlit campfires]) It would also make it harder to transport campfires, as you would actually have to light them.

This would also make campfires easily mobile if you have a shovel, water bucket, or splash water bottles. It would probably be placed in your inventory unlit, so you'd also need a flint & steel to re-light it anyways.

Because of this it is not overpowered.
Amazing Idea!

Maybe call it something different, but a great idea in general.

Edit: Call it something different although it would make sense, Mojang adds enchantments that don't really match any real life terms.
For a name I would suggest Feather Flying or Velocity Protection
Maybe since helmets have enough helmet-exclusive enchants, this could be for elytra instead
Youhfbkk de vous contacter afin de
Being able to change the font size on normal signs would be nice too, but yes, large signs would be great.
Normally minecraft doesn't have giant blocks, I don't think this is a very good idea
I see what you mean but can't you already do this with banners?
You have banners, Map art, and for the giant signs you have blocks.
I think this is a GREAT idea! People should have to settle for using banners or map art as signs.
I like it

This is also optional, but it could be made a pair in 1.17 when they update the mountains:

You're trudging through a Blizzard (possible harmful new weather.) Suddenly, you see a bush half-buried in the growing snow pile ahead. What is it?

That's right; Chilledates.

(These next parts are just things I imagine Mojang implementing if the Chilledates are a hit.) They can be found on the peaks of mountains in the large snow piles, and can be harvested like regular Sweet Berries to get the Chilledate fruit. And here's what it (could) do!

It can only be grown on snow.

When eaten, two things could happen for 30 seconds:

- NEW EFFECT! Lightweight acts like slow falling, gives the ability to walk on water and lets you traverse over Deep Snow (new "snowier snow" that acts like quicksand), but disables activation of pressure plates and halves damage done to other entities.

- NEW EFFECT! Frost Burn causes every hit you make (for the duration of the potion) to give the Slowness effect to the targeted entity.
I personally like the lower light levels. It works really well for certain builds.
I'm pretty sure it's intended not to be as bright.

The soul fire is intended to be dimmer, and the torches and lanterns to match. If it's a personal preference, put glowstone behind stairs or something to get more light in a build (light shines through stairs, slabs and wall blocks). The soul fire lanterns work well in some cases for ominous/spooky lighting, but it may not be what you want in your builds.

Personally i Like the soul fire lantern and torch light level BUT it spawns creepers and mobs inside your haunted house that you built, Why not just make the mobs scared of the lightsource that they won't spawn in the radius of the 16block like normal torch / latnern But the light still will be weak,

 

As for the Soul campfires should have an chanse of possession in the food cooked, Which means that player will make random movememnt after eating the food made in the soul campfire. But it will also give swiftness 2 whit the food,

 

These are just ideas for the soul fire lightsources.
I was actually about to post this.....
It should be higher than normal light sources because it's factually true that fire is blue when it burns hotter. Hotter flame = more light.
You could use dye to change the colour of the clay before it is dried.

Yes! I especially want brownish and tan-ish bricks (end stone is just too much of a neon yellow: I want something softer), as well as maybe bricks that are less pinkish and more orange-ish. And a slight amount of variation to the coloring of the bricks withinn one block would be nice for each of these new types of bricks. Keep the original ones monotone, but the others would look better with slight variations.
YES PLEASE THIS WOULD BE GREAT! Im trying to build a city and yet the only brick colours there are red. What if i want white or black?
I agree to this because it makes it easier and livable into nether.
Brilliant! A lack of paper has stunted my nether-only survival challenge. Adding paper in the form of cane would give the nether a greater sense of completeness.
you can still get bookshelves in the nether by finding enchanted books and using a grindstone on them.
Could that be in ice biomes also?

Silverfish need homes too, but I don't think we need to add a new block.... we could have a new thing where the Silverfish live in netherite, or ancient ruins, but not in a new block. Unless it already exists and I am too late to comment on it because a new update just came.

La verdad es muy buena y resumida a diferencia de mi idea

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/14730311668493--La-nueva-dimensi%C3%B3n-que-apareci%C3%B3-el-1-de-abril-de-el-a%C3%B1o-2023-
would work well in new ambience drop

I can see the benefits--and drawbacks--to this, but tbh, I don't see a need.

Most mobs you encounter at night (baring animals) are undead mobs, spiders, and creepers, add in the occasional witch and enderman for fun. Each of these types of mobs has a designated enchantment already (smite for undead, Bane of Arthropods for spiders sharpness for everything else), and it's not until mid-late game that you're gonna be adventuring outside at night anyway. TBH, this just sounds like a worse version of sharpness as that can work all day and do damage to all types of mobs.
Maybe add a DayBane or whatever it would be called
Do you mean the offhand?

Mmmm....No?

Why? I mean you just have to place your crafting table, craft your stuff and then destroy it, it just takes less than a minute.

Why such a specific thing like this?
